name: Socrates
what_did:
Socrates asked deep questions about life, truth, and goodness.
He didn’t write anything down — instead, he talked with people and challenged their ideas.
He taught by asking questions, a method now called the Socratic method.
why_matters:
Socrates helped start Western philosophy.
He showed that asking good questions is one of the best ways to learn.
Even though he was sentenced to death, he stayed true to his beliefs.
fun_fact: Socrates never charged money for teaching — he just loved talking and learning!
